TopicTitle: Oxidizer does not cross-feed from radial tanks?

Articles.Content:
Hi,

I was trying to update a radial LFO tank and I've noticed that now fuel will cross-feed but not oxidizer. Kind of disappointing as I know there's more than one mod out there with parts that would have benefited from allowing radial cross-feed. I guess that will still be dependent on plug-ins. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
Fuel and oxidizer never cross fed from radial parts afaik and I don't see anything about it in the changelog. Are you sure fuel crossfeeds now?
Yea fuel does, they added wet wings. Check out the new shuttle wings they default to empty so you have to tweak fuel into them.

you can edit the cfg to allow how resources move ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

theres also crossfeedenabler if it updated (though id bet the old version still works if no update)

> 
> Yea fuel does, they added wet wings. Check out the new shuttle wings they default to empty so you have to tweak fuel into them.

I wonder if it's as simple as adding `fuelCrossFeed = True` to get fuel to flow out of radial tanks.

> 
> I wonder if it's as simple as adding `fuelCrossFeed = True` to get fuel to flow out of radial tanks.

That works for fuel but not Oxidizer unfortunately.

You need right engine configuration if you want to fuelcrosfeed from radial attached thanks or through decouples.If you take rapier engine and set it to "closed cycle",it will drain both resources from all attached tanks,radial and core.Maybe you will find [this](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117983-Aren-t-decouplers-supposed-to-block-fuel-flow) helpful.
